info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 5:22PM PDT until October 13 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, southeastern Alameda and eastern Contra Costa.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Antioch, Livermore, Pleasanton, Pittsburg, Dublin, Oakley, Brentwood, Discovery Bay, Byron, Knightsen, Blackhawk-Camino Tassajara, Sunol, Los Vaqueros and Bethel Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING
